history.content: The point here is that while you might put yourself on the waitlist, Applied Math majors and L&S Undeclared students with appointments after you can enrol directly into the class, bypassing the waitlist. It might still make sense (if the waitlist is processed at the start of Phase 2, so you get in before Phase 2 appointments start), but you don't really have a good way to tell if you will get into the class, so it's a gamble.

Due to the new restrictions for enrolling into math UD classes, I keep hearing that we should wait till phase II to register. But what's wrong with putting ourselves in the waitlist during phase I? I feel like that's strictly better than waiting till phase II. Maybe I'm missing the point.
history.subject: Why Phase II Math UDs?
